blog_description: Industrial engineers evaluate and improve production processes. Their responsibilities include evaluating production schedules and process flows, determining ways to improve efficiency and developing management control systems for improved effectiveness and lowered costs.

Biomedical engineering is the application of the principles and problem-solving techniques of engineering to biology and medicine. ... Biomedical engineering focuses on the advances that improve human health and health care at all levels.

Environmental engineers research and develop ways to better protect and improve the environment. They may focus on air pollution, wastewater management, soil quality, water-borne diseases, environmental remediation, ozone depletion or other targeted areas.

Marine engineers work with constructions that are used on or in the water. This includes submarines, tankers, aircraft carriers and sailboats. They work primarily with the internal systems of these ships, including the electrical, refrigeration, propulsion and steering systems. The architectural elements of the ship fall under the purview of the naval architect, who deals with the form and structure surrounding the marine engineer’s systems.

Civil engineers typically work for the government, designing and developing cities or towns. They may work on buildings, roads, tunnels, dams, airports and bridges. They are responsible for assessing an area’s needs and designing constructions that facilitate a safe commute and productive function.
